strategyDetails:
Thanks to its bulk, Primarina continuously checks threats such as Keldeo and Salamence by healing itself with Rest while taking advantage of its excellent STAB combination with Sleep Talk. Rest allows it to not be ruined by status such as Toxic from Aegislash and Krookodile. Moonblast is great neutral coverage while also proving super effective damage on Kommo-o and Galarian Moltres. Scald allows Primarina to get a burn on switch-ins like Amoonguss, Celesteela, and Tentacruel, negating the recovery from their items. 124 Special Defense EVs and Leftovers allow Primarina to avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Chandelure's Shadow Ball and 3HKO from Salamence's Hurricane from full HP without Stealth Rock, with the rest put into Defense to take on Dragon Dance Salamence and Keldeo's Secret Sword better. Leftovers is great, as it synergizes well with Rest + Sleep Talk, but Heavy-Duty Boots is an option to negate damage from entry hazards if the team has unreliable or no hazard removal.

RestTalk Primarina is mainly used on bulky teams that appreciate a status sponge and value the defensive qualities its typing provides. Necrozma is an excellent partner, as it can threaten Amoonguss and Tentacruel, that would otherwise counter Primarina. Zarude checks Rotom-W and Chansey while appreciating Primarina checking Keldeo and Kommo-o. Fire-types such as Rotom-H and Moltres can help check Grass-types such as Zarude and Assault Vest Tangrowth, and provide momentum with Volt Switch and U-turn. Hazard control is important for Primarina to not be chipped down easily and forced to use Rest if it is running Leftovers. Salamence removes entry hazards with Defog and checks Zarude well. Kommo-o, Rhyperior, and Assault Vest Tangrowth can all form solid defensive cores with Primarina, as they are able to check Pokemon such as Volcanion, Thundurus, and Rotom-W nicely, while Primarina checks Salamence, Keldeo, and Moltres in return.

pokemonAbilities.abilityDetails: At 1/3 or less of its max HP, this Pokemon's attacking stat is 1.5x with Water attacks.
This Pokemon's sound-based moves become Water type.

strategyItems.itemDetails: At the end of every turn, holder restores 1/16 of its max HP.
When switching in, the holder is unaffected by hazards on its side of the field.

strategyAbilities.abilityDetails: At 1/3 or less of its max HP, this Pokemon's attacking stat is 1.5x with Water attacks.

strategyFirstMoves.moveDetails: 30% chance to lower the target's Sp. Atk by 1.

strategySecondMoves.moveDetails: 30% chance to burn the target. Thaws target.

strategyThirdMoves.moveDetails: User sleeps 2 turns and restores HP and status.

strategyFourthMoves.moveDetails: User must be asleep. Uses another known move.
